title: Simulation-Based Optimization Learning for Autonomous Vehicle Platoon Control

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Calculus and Linear Algebra, with Fundamental Vehicle Dynamics Concepts
context.additional_context: Targeting office/administrative professionals, the primary goal is improving practical application skills in mathematical modeling and optimization techniques

learning_goals: For dynamic modeling of platoon control systems, learners can mathematically represent interaction parameters between vehicles
Using simulation tools, learners can define and solve platoon control optimization problems under safety constraints
Through hierarchical optimization algorithm design, learners can explain synchronized convergence characteristics for vehicle entry/exit scenarios
Applying performance-based control techniques, learners can implement control algorithms ensuring state variables remain within predefined safe domains
Learners can mathematically model optimization control problems in heterogeneous vehicle environments and validate them through simulation
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
